modules.description: This module supports text styling with a 16-color palette and attributes like bold or underlined, along with cursor positioning, screen manipulation (e.g., erasing regions, scrolling), and terminal resizing. It operates on ANSI-compliant terminals and Windows shells, using style codes and cursor state management to enable dynamic output formatting. Specific use cases include building interactive command-line interfaces, real-time terminal visualizations, and tools requiring precise control over text rendering and cursor behavior in supported environments.

This module enables customization of terminal prompt appearance through text styling operations, including setting foreground/background colors, text attributes like bold or underlined, and icon-based indicators. It works with a composite style type that combines ANSI formatting directives and string-based icons to control visual elements across prompt components. Typical use cases include highlighting critical prompts with color contrasts, applying consistent branding through themed styles, or enhancing readability via text decorations like underlined headers.

This module provides functions to create interactive command line prompts for user input, including confirmation, password entry, string input, and option selection. It supports styled text output through a composite style type that combines ANSI formatting and icons, allowing visual customization of prompts. Concrete use cases include building guided setup wizards, secure login interfaces, and menu-driven CLI tools with visual feedback.
